YEScoder

YEScoder is a repository for Young Empowered Scientists at Dana-Farber Cancer Institute

Our work with this package will emphasize the use of programming with R in several domains

  • working with images as digital files that are manipulated and displayed for human visualization

  • working with maps that provide location information on cancer incidence

  • working with public information on cancer genomics and genetics

Visit the “Get started” tab, follow instructions, and get coding!
